Token.Abstract: An RMMapView object provides an embeddable map interface, similar to the one provided by Apple's MapKit. You use this class to display map information and to manipulate the map contents from your application. You can center the map on a given coordinate, specify the size of the area you want to display, and annotate the map with custom information.
The receiver's delegate.
The receiver's delegate.
A Boolean value that determines whether the user may scroll around the map.
A Boolean value that determines whether the user may scroll around the map.

A Boolean value that determines whether the map view bounces past the edge of content and back again and whether it animates the content scaling when the scaling exceeds the maximum or minimum limits.

A Boolean value that determines whether the map view bounces past the edge of content and back again and whether it animates the content scaling when the scaling exceeds the maximum or minimum limits.

A Boolean value that determines whether double-tap zooms of the map always zoom on the center of the map, or whether they zoom on the center of the double-tap gesture. The default value is NO, which zooms on the gesture.

A Boolean value that determines whether double-tap zooms of the map always zoom on the center of the map, or whether they zoom on the center of the double-tap gesture. The default value is NO, which zooms on the gesture.
A custom deceleration mode for the map view for drag operations. Set to RMMapDecelerationOff to disable map drag deceleration. The default value is RMMapDecelerationFast.
A custom deceleration mode for the map view for drag operations. Set to RMMapDecelerationOff to disable map drag deceleration. The default value is RMMapDecelerationFast.
A Boolean value that adjusts the display of map tile images for retina-capable screens.
A Boolean value that adjusts the display of map tile images for retina-capable screens.
Whether to hide map data attribution for the map view.
Whether to hide map data attribution for the map view.

Take missing tiles from lower-numbered zoom levels, up to a given number of zoom levels. This can be used in order to increase perceived tile load performance or to allow zooming in beyond levels supported natively by a given tile source. Defaults to 1.

Take missing tiles from lower-numbered zoom levels, up to a given number of zoom levels. This can be used in order to increase perceived tile load performance or to allow zooming in beyond levels supported natively by a given tile source. Defaults to 1.
A custom, static view to use behind the map tiles. The default behavior is to use grid imagery that moves with map panning like MapKit.
A custom, static view to use behind the map tiles. The default behavior is to use grid imagery that moves with map panning like MapKit.
A custom image to use behind the map tiles. The default behavior is to show the default backgroundView and not a static image.
A Boolean value indicating whether to draw tile borders and z/x/y numbers on tile images for debugging purposes. Defaults to NO.
A Boolean value indicating whether to draw tile borders and z/x/y numbers on tile images for debugging purposes. Defaults to NO.
A Boolean value indicating whether to show a small logo in the corner of the map view. Defaults to YES.
A Boolean value indicating whether to show a small logo in the corner of the map view. Defaults to YES.
Initialize a map view with a given frame. A default watermarked MapBox map tile source will be used.
Initialize a map view with a given frame and tile source.

Parameter.Name: frame
Parameter.Abstract: The frame with which to initialize the map view.

Parameter.Name: newTilesource
Parameter.Abstract: The tile source to use for the map tiles.

ReturnValue.Abstract: An initialized map view, or nil if the map view was unable to be initialized.

Token.Abstract: Designated initializer. Initialize a map view.

Parameter.Name: frame
Parameter.Abstract: The map view's frame.

Parameter.Name: newTilesource
Parameter.Abstract: A tile source to use for the map tiles.

Parameter.Name: initialCenterCoordinate
Parameter.Abstract: The starting map center coordinate.

Parameter.Name: initialTileSourceZoomLevel
Parameter.Abstract: The starting map zoom level, clamped to the zoom levels supported by the tile source(s).

Parameter.Name: initialTileSourceMaxZoomLevel
Parameter.Abstract: The maximum zoom level allowed by the map view, clamped to the zoom levels supported by the tile source(s).

Parameter.Name: initialTileSourceMinZoomLevel
Parameter.Abstract: The minimum zoom level allowed by the map view, clamped to the zoom levels supported by the tile source(s).

Parameter.Name: backgroundImage
Parameter.Abstract: A custom background image to use behind the map instead of the default gridded tile background that moves with the map.

ReturnValue.Abstract: An initialized map view, or nil if a map view was unable to be initialized.

Token.Abstract: The center coordinate of the map view.
The center coordinate of the map view.
The center point of the map represented as a projected point.
The center point of the map represented as a projected point.
Set the map center to a given coordinate.

Parameter.Name: coordinate
Parameter.Abstract: A coordinate to set as the map center.

Parameter.Name: animated
Parameter.Abstract: Whether to animate the change to the map center.

Token.Abstract: Set the map center to a given projected point.

Parameter.Name: aPoint
Parameter.Abstract: A projected point to set as the map center.

Parameter.Name: animated
Parameter.Abstract: Whether to animate the change to the map center.

Token.Abstract: Move the map center by a given delta.

Parameter.Name: delta
Parameter.Abstract: A CGSize by which to move the map center.

Token.Abstract: The current zoom level of the map.
The current zoom level of the map.
The minimum zoom level of the map, clamped to the range supported by the tile source(s).
The minimum zoom level of the map, clamped to the range supported by the tile source(s).
The maximum zoom level of the map, clamped to the range supported by the tile source(s).
The maximum zoom level of the map, clamped to the range supported by the tile source(s).
Set zoom level, optionally with an animation.

Parameter.Name: newZoom
Parameter.Abstract: The desired zoom level.

Parameter.Name: animated
Parameter.Abstract: Whether to animate the map change.

Token.Abstract: Set both zoom level and center coordinate at the same time, optionally with an animation.

Parameter.Name: newZoom
Parameter.Abstract: The desired zoom level.

Parameter.Name: newCenter
Parameter.Abstract: The desired center coordinate.

Parameter.Name: animated
Parameter.Abstract: Whether to animate the map change.

Token.Abstract: Zoom the map by a given factor near a certain point.

Parameter.Name: zoomFactor
Parameter.Abstract: The factor by which to zoom the map.

Parameter.Name: center
Parameter.Abstract: The point at which to zoom the map.

Parameter.Name: animated
Parameter.Abstract: Whether to animate the zoom.

Token.Abstract: Zoom the map in at the next integral zoom level near a certain point.

Parameter.Name: pivot
Parameter.Abstract: The point at which to zoom the map.

Parameter.Name: animated
Parameter.Abstract: Whether to animate the zoom.

Token.Abstract: Zoom the map out at the next integral zoom level near a certain point.

Parameter.Name: pivot
Parameter.Abstract: The point at which to zoom the map.

Parameter.Name: animated
Parameter.Abstract: Whether to animate the zoom.

Token.Abstract: Zoom the map to a given latitude and longitude bounds.

Parameter.Name: southWest
Parameter.Abstract: The southwest point to zoom to.

Parameter.Name: northEast
Parameter.Abstract: The northeast point to zoom to.

Parameter.Name: animated
Parameter.Abstract: Whether to animate the zoom.

Token.Abstract: The smallest bounding box containing the entire map view.
The smallest bounding box containing a rectangular region of the map view.

Parameter.Name: rect
Parameter.Abstract: A rectangular region.

Token.Abstract: Contrain zooming and panning of the map view to a given coordinate boundary.

Parameter.Name: southWest
Parameter.Abstract: The southwest point to constrain to.

Parameter.Name: northEast
Parameter.Abstract: The northeast point to constrain to.

Token.Abstract: Take a snapshot of the map view.

ReturnValue.Abstract: An image depicting the map view.

Token.Abstract: Take a snapshot of the map view.

Parameter.Name: includeOverlay
Parameter.Abstract: Whether to include the overlay containing any visible annotations.

ReturnValue.Abstract: An image depicting the map view.

Token.Abstract: The annotations currently added to the map. Includes user location annotations, if any.
The annotations currently added to the map. Includes user location annotations, if any.
The annotations currently visible on the map. May include annotations currently shown in clusters.
The annotations currently visible on the map. May include annotations currently shown in clusters.
Add an annotation to the map.

Parameter.Name: annotation
Parameter.Abstract: The annotation to add.

Token.Abstract: Add one or more annotations to the map.

Parameter.Name: annotations
Parameter.Abstract: An array containing the annotations to add to the map.

Token.Abstract: Remove an annotation from the map.

Parameter.Name: annotation
Parameter.Abstract: The annotation to remove.

Token.Abstract: Remove one or more annotations from the map.

Parameter.Name: annotations
Parameter.Abstract: An array containing the annotations to remove from the map.

Token.Abstract: Remove all annotations from the map. This does not remove user location annotations, if any.
The screen position for a given annotation.

Parameter.Name: annotation
Parameter.Abstract: The annotation for which to return the current screen position.

ReturnValue.Abstract: The screen position of the annotation.

Token.Abstract: Selects the specified annotation and displays a callout view for it.

Parameter.Name: annotation
Parameter.Abstract: The annotation object to select.

Parameter.Name: animated
Parameter.Abstract: If YES, the callout view is animated into position.

Token.Abstract: Deselects the specified annotation and hides its callout view.

Parameter.Name: annotation
Parameter.Abstract: The annotation object to deselect.

Parameter.Name: animated
Parameter.Abstract: If YES, the callout view is animated offscreen.

Token.Abstract: The annotation that is currently selected.
The annotation that is currently selected.
Whether to enable clustering of map point annotations. Defaults to NO.
Whether to enable clustering of map point annotations. Defaults to NO.
Whether to order markers on the z-axis according to increasing y-position. Defaults to YES.
Whether to order markers on the z-axis according to increasing y-position. Defaults to YES.
Whether to position cluster markers at the weighted center of the points they represent. If YES, position clusters in weighted fashion. If NO, position them on a rectangular grid. Defaults to YES.
Whether to position cluster markers at the weighted center of the points they represent. If YES, position clusters in weighted fashion. If NO, position them on a rectangular grid. Defaults to YES.
Whether to order cluster markers above non-clustered markers. Defaults to NO.
Whether to order cluster markers above non-clustered markers. Defaults to NO.
The first tile source of a map view, ordered from bottom to top.
The first tile source of a map view, ordered from bottom to top.
All of the tile sources for a map view, ordered bottom to top.
All of the tile sources for a map view, ordered bottom to top.
Add a tile source to a map view above the current tile sources.

Parameter.Name: tileSource
Parameter.Abstract: The tile source to add.

Token.Abstract: Add a tile source to a map view at a given index.

Parameter.Name: tileSource
Parameter.Abstract: The tile source to add.

Parameter.Name: index
Parameter.Abstract: The index at which to add the tile source. A value of zero adds the tile source below all other tile sources.

Token.Abstract: Remove a tile source from the map view.

Parameter.Name: tileSource
Parameter.Abstract: The tile source to remove.

Token.Abstract: Remove the tile source at a given index from the map view.

Parameter.Name: index
Parameter.Abstract: The index of the tile source to remove.

Token.Abstract: Move the tile source at one index to another index.

Parameter.Name: fromIndex
Parameter.Abstract: The index of the tile source to move.

Parameter.Name: toIndex
Parameter.Abstract: The destination index for the tile source.

Token.Abstract: Hide or show a tile source.

Parameter.Name: isHidden
Parameter.Abstract: A Boolean indicating whether to hide the tile source or not.

Parameter.Name: tileSource
Parameter.Abstract: The tile source to hide or show.

Token.Abstract: Hide or show a tile source at a given index.

Parameter.Name: isHidden
Parameter.Abstract: A Boolean indicating whether to hide the tile source or not.

Parameter.Name: index
Parameter.Abstract: The index of the tile source to hide or show.

Token.Abstract: Reload the tiles for a given tile source.

Parameter.Name: tileSource
Parameter.Abstract: The tile source to reload.

Token.Abstract: Reload the tiles for a tile source at a given index.

Parameter.Name: index
Parameter.Abstract: The index of the tile source to reload.

Token.Abstract: The tile cache for the map view, typically composed of both an in-memory RMMemoryCache and a disk-based RMDatabaseCache.
The tile cache for the map view, typically composed of both an in-memory RMMemoryCache and a disk-based RMDatabaseCache.
Clear all tile images from the caching system.

Parameter.Abstract: The coordinate to convert.

Parameter.Abstract: A projected point to convert.

Token.Abstract: Return the bounding box for a given map tile.

Parameter.Abstract: A map tile.

Token.Abstract: A Boolean value indicating whether the map may display the user location.

A Boolean value indicating whether the devices current location is visible in the map view. (read-only)
A Boolean value indicating whether the devices current location is visible in the map view. (read-only)
The mode used to track the user location.
The mode used to track the user location.
Whether the map view should display a heading calibration alert when necessary. The default value is YES.
Whether the map view should display a heading calibration alert when necessary. The default value is YES.

Parameter.Name: mode
Parameter.Abstract: The mode used to track the user location.

Parameter.Name: animated
Parameter.Abstract: Whether changes to the map center or rotation should be animated when the mode is changed.
